name: City of Austin Summer Camps
notes: Multiple camp programs available including general youth camps, specialty camps, and teen programs. No camp on June 19 or July 3 (city holidays).
registrationDate: Early registration Jan 31-Feb 6 for financial aid recipients; general registration by category later
cost: $140/week for residents; $220 for non-residents; $20 deposit. Some specialty camps have different pricing.

name: Fantastic Magic Camp
notes: Magic, puppetry, juggling, and performance arts. Includes live shows, theme days, plus indoor and outdoor activities. Daily hours: 9:00am-4:00pm.
dates: May 28 - August 9, 2026 (Crestview location). Mt Playmore: June 17-28 and July 8-19 for younger ages 5-8.
cost: $425/week for 5-day weeks; $340 for 4-day holiday weeks (Memorial Day, 4th of July). Sibling discounts available.
location: North Central Austin (Crestview): 7500 Woodrow Ave, Austin, TX 78757. South Pflugerville (Mt Playmore): 13609 N Interstate Hwy 35, Austin, TX 78753

name: Pine Cove in the City
notes: Christian day camp with activities, games, and character building. Drop-off/pick-up schedule: 9am-4pm.
dates: June 8th-12th, 2026 (also programs at ACF: June 9-13 & July 21-25)
location: 6401 River Place Boulevard, Austin, TX 78730 (Austin Christian Fellowship)

name: Nike US Sports Camps
notes: Various sports camps including basketball, soccer, tennis, and more. Multiple locations and dates available.
registrationDate: Check website for specific registration dates
cost: Varies by camp type and duration

name: Concordia Texas Baseball Camp
notes: Baseball skills development camp for various skill levels.

name: First Tee Austin (Golf Camp)
notes: Golf instruction and character development. Standard camps for ages 5-12; PGA-level camps for ages 13-17. Full-day and half-day options available.
cost: Varies by age and program: Advanced half-day for ages 13-17 is $350; younger ages $160-$280 depending on full vs half day
location: Harvey Penick Golf Campus, 5501 Ed Bluestein Blvd, Austin, TX 78723

name: Balcones Country Club
notes: 2026 dates and rates coming soon. Camp day: 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM. Before-care (8:30-9:00) and after-care (3:00-4:00) available.

name: Idea Lab Kids
notes: STEM-focused camps with hands-on learning activities.

name: Hearts and Paws
notes: Unique camp combining dog training and child activities. Summer fun and learning for dogs & kids together.

name: Snapology
notes: STEAM-focused camps using LEGO®, robotics, coding, and more. Themes rotate weekly. Both full-day and half-day options. Extended care available (8am-5:15pm) for extra fee.
dates: Summer 2026: May 27 - August 15 (Discovery Center location). Weekly camps and one-day workshops available.
location: Discovery Center and other Austin locations

name: Creator Camp
notes: Creative and maker-focused camp activities.

name: Spicewood Country School
notes: Camp registration will be in person and is on a first come, first served basis.
registrationDate: In-person registration, first come first served

name: Saplings Studio
notes: Arts and nature-based camp programs.

name: JCC Austin
notes: Jewish Community Center summer camps with various programs. Priority registration for current Dell JCC members opens January 27 at 10:00 AM. Community registration opens February 5!
ages: Check website for age ranges by program
cost: Check website for pricing (member discounts available)

name: YMCA of Central Texas - General Information
notes: YMCA of Central Texas offers a wide variety of summer day camps across multiple locations. Programs focus on character development, outdoor education, swimming, arts and crafts, archery, rock climbing, and more. Camp ABC's: Accomplishment, Belonging, and Character. Core values: Honesty, Caring, Respect, and Responsibility. Before/after care options available. Discounts for members. Multiple locations and schedules available including Outdoor Day Camps, Adventure Academy, Specialty Camps, and Overnight Camps.
ages: Grades K-9 (Outdoor Day Camp), Ages 8-14 (Overnight Camp), varies by specialty program
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th (Waco's: March 9th-13th). Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th (specific start and end dates may vary by location). Overnight Camp: June 7th - August 1st
cost: Prices vary by location, program type, and member status. Spring Break: $150-$250/week. Summer rates vary. Member discounts available.
location: Multiple locations: Round Rock, Cedar Park, Hutto, Waco, Brazos Valley, Twin Lakes, CHASCO, and more

name: Magellan International School
notes: Launching an all-new program this February! International school with diverse summer programs.
dates: Check website for 2026 dates (new program launching February)
registrationDate: Check website for registration (new program details coming in February)

name: Cordovan Art School
notes: No dates yet for 2026. Art-focused camps with various mediums and techniques.
cost: $549 a week, or $68 per half day

name: Camp Tech Revolution (Lavner Education)
notes: Cutting-edge tech camps focusing on coding, robotics, game design, and STEM. Weekly sessions available.
ages: Check website for age requirements by program
dates: June 8th to July 24th, 2026 for weekly tech camps
registrationDate: Register today 1/10 for the discount price of $549

name: Austin Gymnastics Club
notes: No dates listed yet for 2026. Gymnastics instruction and skill development.

name: Zach Theater (Theater Camp)
notes: STAY TUNED FOR SUMMER 2026 Camp Availability! Theater and performing arts camps.

name: Camp Paramount (Theater Camp)
notes: Theater performance camps with full production experience.
location: Paramount Theatre and other locations - check website

name: Austin Scottish Rite Theater (Theater Camp)
notes: Check back for dates. Theater camps with one-week and two-week options.
cost: One-Week Camp: $300 per camper; Two-week camp: $600 per camper

name: Creative Action
notes: Arts and theater camps with hands-on creative activities. Visual and performing arts programs.

name: GirlStart
notes: STEM-focused camps for girls. Registration opens Monday, February 2, 2026. Early-bird discount: $55 off per week if registering before end of February. Payment plan available.
dates: Summer 2026 - specific session dates vary by week
cost: $450 per week; early-bird discount available. $225 deposit per week; balance split over April & May

name: Kidventure
notes: Outdoor adventures, character-building, screen-free experiences. Day camps and overnight camps available. Multiple locations across Austin and Texas Hill Country.
dates: Summer 2026 - registrations open; check specific dates per area
cost: Varies by location, program type, and day vs overnight

name: Summer Wonders (ACE Academy)
notes: Creative, exploratory camps at picturesque campus. Programs range from arts to culinary to STEM. Hands-on and exploratory learning. Specialty camps like 'Cool'inary Boot Camp' available.
ages: Preschool through middle school (varies by program)
dates: Summer 2026 - example: Cool'inary Boot Camp runs June 22-26, 2026
registrationDate: Registration open now through at least March 22, 2026 for some sessions

name: Apex Kids Camps
notes: Sports camps, adventure weeks, leadership, and service project themes. Fun and active day camps. Daily schedule usually 9am-3pm. Multiple locations and weekly themes.
dates: Weekly sessions: June 1-5, June 8-12, and multiple weeks through summer 2026
cost: Check website for specific pricing by location and session
location: Multiple locations: Steiner Ranch, South Austin, Round Rock, Kyle/Buda, Leander

name: Austin Sunshine Camps
notes: FREE overnight, traditional camp for qualifying youth (free/reduced lunch or foster care). Crucially fills access gaps; great option for families with financial need.
dates: Multiple sessions each summer; 10-day/9-night and shorter 6-night options depending on age
registrationDate: Registration required - check website for dates

name: Dougherty Arts Center - Summer Art Escape
notes: Visual & performing arts camps. Full day (7:30 AM-6:00 PM). Varied media and unstructured/structured play. Specialty camps with 3-week maximum per participant per site.
ages: Ages 5-11 for Art Escape; ages 12-14 for Summer Art Lab
dates: Weekly sessions from June 8 through August 7, 2026. Sessions run Monday-Friday
registrationDate: Pre-registration required. Check website for registration dates
cost: $140/week for City of Austin residents; $220/week for non-residents

name: Austin Nature & Science Center
notes: Nature-based educational programs: outdoor learning, exploring ecosystems, hands-on activities. Daily 7:30am-6:00pm. Age groups: Frogs (4-5), Salamanders (6-8), Pathfinders (9-10), etc.
dates: June 9 - August 13, 2026; daily 7:30am-6:00pm. No camp on certain holidays
registrationDate: Early registration for financial aid recipients in February; general registration later
location: Austin Nature & Science Center, Austin, TX

name: UTeach Outreach Summer Camps
notes: STEM-focused university-based camps. University of Texas at Austin program offering science, technology, engineering, and math education.
cost: $599-$2500 depending on length (5-week programs more expensive)

name: Neuron Garage
notes: STEM/Tech/Makers camps. Hands-on technology and engineering activities.

name: CampityCamp
notes: One-stop discovery and booking platform for multiple camps. Offers filtering by age, budget, and type. Multiple themes: Art, STEM, Sports, Overnight, etc.

name: Camp Champions
notes: Traditional overnight camp with athletics, leadership, outdoor skills, and adventure activities.
dates: Sessions run 1-5 weeks, depending on age and program

name: Camp El Tesoro
notes: ACA-accredited overnight camp, day camp, plus grief-camp for children. Multi-use facility with outdoor education programs.
ages: Varies by program (overnight typically older kids, day camp younger)
dates: Summer season - specific dates posted on website
cost: Fees depend on overnight vs day camp

name: KE Camps - Camp Great Hills
notes: Traditional day camp at Great Hills Country Club. Activities include golf (2 sessions/week), tennis (2 sessions/week), swimming (Tuesday-Friday), arts & crafts, group games, fun with foods, STEM challenges, and archery tag. Wacky Wednesdays with themed activities and Thankful Thursdays with community service projects. Camp hours: 9:00am-3:00pm. Drop-off: 8:30-9:00am, Pick-up: 3:00-3:30pm. Lunch and snacks provided by club. Nut-aware camp.
ages: 5-10 (must be 5 by first day of camp, potty-trained)
registrationDate: Registration for Summer 2026 will open soon
cost: 2026 rates coming soon. Registration fee: $45 (includes 2 camp shirts). Full payment due upon registration. ACH payments preferred; credit cards subject to 2.75% surcharge.
location: 5914 Lost Horizon Drive, Austin, TX 78759 (Great Hills Country Club)

name: Cedar Park - CompuChild STEAM Camps
notes: Entrepreneurial STEAM programs offering creative writing, robotics, debate, video game design, coding, drones, AI game creation, and chess. Wide range of educational classes and camps for youth interested in STEAM and beyond.

name: Cedar Park - WIZE Computing Academy Camps
notes: STEAM programs for young learners including game design and development, AI and robotics, and computer coding. Classes create space for ample student-to-teacher learning ratios with goal of expanding youth curiosity. Programs include 3D Designing, Modeling & Printing, and 2D Game Animation Development Using Scratch.

name: Cedar Park - Preschool Nature Camp
notes: Nature-themed activities, hikes, scavenger hunts, and education combine into one great program for this parent-and-me nature camp. Camp meets each day at a different park in Cedar Park.
location: Various parks in Cedar Park, TX

name: Cedar Park - Cannons Lacrosse Summer Camp
notes: Lacrosse camp for all skill levels. Perfect for beginners and those looking to work on stick and shooting skills. No experience required. Sticks provided if you don't have one. Please bring mouthguard and water.
location: Lakeline Park, Cedar Park, TX (multi-purpose practice fields)

name: Cedar Park - Lone Star Hoops Basketball Camp
notes: Original basketball camp when Cedar Park Recreation Center opened in 2009. 4-day camps including 30+ hours of high-energy, up-beat, total immersion basketball skill development. Campers receive full-size basketball, Lone Star Hoops t-shirt, and compete for dozens of ribbons, medals, trophies and assortment of awards.
location: Cedar Park Recreation Center, Cedar Park, TX

name: Cedar Park - COOL'inary Cooking Club - Basic Training Baking Boot Camp
notes: Baking camp for aspiring bakers who love to get their hands sticky in the kitchen. Young chefs learn basics of scratch-baking and make everything from pita bread to lemon tarts, challah to cornbread, and more. Create sweet and savory baked goods in this tasty, engaging, and imaginative camp!

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Camp Round Rock
notes: Outdoor Day Camp with activities including archery, rock climbing, arts and crafts, and much more. Camp focuses on helping campers develop confidence, improve social skills, and learn new skills. Full-day camp option. Camp hours: 7am-6pm.
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th. Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th (specific start and end dates may vary by location)
cost: Spring Break: $210-$240/week depending on member status. Summer rates vary by location and member status.
location: Camp Round Rock, Round Rock, TX

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Camp Twin Lakes
notes: Outdoor Day Camp with activities including archery, rock climbing, arts and crafts, and much more. Camp focuses on helping campers develop confidence, improve social skills, and learn new skills. Full-day camp option. Camp hours: 7am-6pm.
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th. Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th (specific start and end dates may vary by location)
cost: Spring Break: $225-$250/week depending on member status. Summer rates vary by location and member status.

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Camp Brightwell
notes: Outdoor Day Camp with activities including archery, rock climbing, arts and crafts, and much more. Camp hours: 7am-6pm.
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th. Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th
cost: $200-$200/week depending on member status. Summer rates vary.

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Camp Brazos Valley
notes: Day Camp at the YMCA of Central Texas. Campers spend their week outdoors participating in a wide range of exciting camp activities focused on developing confidence, improving social skills, and learning new skills. Activities include rock climbing, creative arts, archery and much more. Campers should bring a nut-free lunch and water bottle; snack provided. Camp hours: 7am-6pm.
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 9th-13th. Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th
cost: $185-$200/week depending on member status. Summer rates vary.

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Greater Waco YMCA Spring Break Camp
notes: Spring Break camp with opportunity to participate in exciting spring activities, including swimming, arts & crafts, STEAM, rock wall, archery and more! Camp hours: 7am-6pm.

name: YMCA of Central Texas - CHASCO Family YMCA Spring Break Camp
notes: Spring Break camp at CHASCO Family YMCA. Give your child the chance to make new friends, discover new talents, and enjoy a spring break full of fun and adventure! Camp hours: 9am-1pm.

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Double File Spring Break Camp
notes: Spring Break camp for kids in Kinder - 5th Grade. Uses fun and challenging activities while on-site to help each camper 'Discover their own Adventure' this spring!
location: Double File Elementary, Round Rock, TX

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Bar W Spring Break Camp
notes: Spring Break camp for kids in Kinder - 5th Grade. Uses fun and challenging activities while on-site to help each camper 'Discover their own Adventure' this spring!

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Adventure Academy Camps
notes: Indoor Full-Day Camp, known as Adventure Academy. Offered at various ISDs around Williamson County, and in WISD. Spring Break locations: Mitchell Elementary (GISD), Nadine Johnson Elementary (HISD), Grandview Hills Elementary (LISD), Pleasant Hill Elementary (LISD), Bar W Elementary (LHISD), Double File Elementary (RRISD), Great Oaks Elementary (RRISD).
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th (Waco's: March 9th-13th). Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th (specific start and end dates may vary by location)
cost: Check website for pricing by location and member status
location: Various ISD locations in Williamson County and WISD

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Specialty Camps
notes: Specialty camps offered at CHASCO, Hutto, Twin Lakes, and Waco. Children can participate in a different camp each week throughout the summer, as well as during spring break or holiday breaks. Half-Day Camps include Art Lab, eSports, Cooking, Basketball, Soccer, Cake Decorating, Gymnastics, Kreative Kids, and More. Camps offered vary by location.
dates: Spring Break Camp: March 16th-20th (Waco's: March 9th-13th). Summer Camp: May 26th - August 17th
cost: Check website for pricing by location and program
location: CHASCO, Hutto, Twin Lakes, and Waco locations

name: YMCA of Central Texas - Overnight Camp
notes: Traditional Overnight Camp is a weeklong camp (Sunday drop-off and Saturday pick-up) for boys and girls with emphasis on skill-building and character development. New for Summer 2026! Half-Week Adventure is a flexible, two-night overnight program that gives campers the excitement of staying at camp while still offering the comfort of a shorter commitment.
location: YMCA of Central Texas overnight camp location

name: ACES4Kids Summer Camp
notes: Summer camp programs - check website for detailed information and program offerings.

name: Camp VÃ¡monos
notes: Spanish immersion summer camp that combines language learning with daily field trips. Campers explore local parks, museums, and attractions while practicing Spanish in real-world contexts. Active exploration and cultural experiences.
